comment.text: RNA-binding protein that acts as a mRNA splicing cofactor by promoting efficient splicing of transcripts that possess weak splice sites. Specifically promotes splicing of many cell-cycle and DNA-repair transcripts that possess weak splice sites, such as TUBG1, KATNB1, TUBGCP2, AURKB, PCNT, AKT1, RAD23A, and FANCG. Probably acts by facilitating the interaction between Serine/arginine-rich proteins such as SRSF2 and the RNA polymerase II. Also binds to DNA; binds to the consensus DNA sequence: 5'-GA[GT]AN[CG][AG]CC-3'. May indirectly repress hepatitis B virus (HBV) core promoter activity and transcription of HBV genes and production of HBV virions. Essential for correct RNA splicing of multiple genes critical for brain development, neuronal migration and metabolism, including TUBG1, FLNA, PNKP, WDR62, PSMD3, PCK2, PFKL, IDH2, and ACY1 (PubMed:27545680).
Interacts with SRSF2. Associates with the spliceosome. Interacts with the AML1-MTG8 (AML1-ETO) fusion protein, possibly leading to trigger signals inhibiting leukemogenesis.
Colocalizes with the pre-mRNA splicing factor SRSF2.
Experimental confirmation may be lacking for some isoforms.
Widely expressed, with the higher expression seen in leukocyte and heart.
Contains 8 types of repeats which are distributed in 3 regions.

disease.name: ZTTK syndrome
disease.description: An autosomal dominant syndrome characterized by intellectual disability, developmental delay, malformations of the cerebral cortex, epilepsy, vision problems, musculo-skeletal abnormalities, and congenital malformations.

comment.text: The disease is caused by mutations affecting the gene represented in this entry.
May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.
May be produced at very low levels due to a premature stop codon in the mRNA, leading to nonsense-mediated mRNA decay.
Contaminating sequence. Sequence of unknown origin in the N-terminal part.

property.value: Brain malformations-musculoskeletal abnormalities-facial dysmorphism-intellectual disability syndrome
Expressed in metanephros and 255 other tissues
P:regulation of mRNA splicing, via spliceosome

feature.description: 17 X 10 AA tandem repeats of L-A-[ST]-[NSG]-[TS]-MDSQM
3 X 11 AA tandem repats of P-P-L-P-P-E-E-P-P-[TME]-[MTG]
4 X 8 AA tandem repeats of V-L-E-SS-[AVT]-VT
Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2)
Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2); alternate
Glycyl lysine isopeptide (Lys-Gly) (interchain with G-Cter in SUMO2)

In isoform A and isoform D.
In ZTTKS; unknown pathological significance; de novo mutation associated in cis with Y-1843.
In ZTTKS; unknown pathological significance; de novo mutation associated in cis with S-1637.
